intro: Anthotroche healiana, commonly known as the sunflower of the genus Anthotroche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow to orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
